required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Isometric Exercises in Healthy Young Individuals
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Single Session of Knee Isometric Exercises on Blood Pressure in Healthy Young Individuals: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A sample of 58 young healthy subjects (25 females, mean age 25.10Â±5.18 years) were randomly allocated to either isometric exercise experimental group (n=29) or active exercise control group (n=29). The Heart Rate (HR), Respiratory Rate (RR), Blood Pressure (BP), Oxygen Saturation (SaO2), and Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP) for each participant were assessed before and after the treatment session.

detailed_description.textblock: The participants in the experimental group underwent a single session of 5-minute quadriceps isometric exercise. The participant was asked to take rest 10 minutes before performed the exercise. After that, the exercise was performed from a long-sitting position. On the other hand, the participants in the control group received a single session of 5-minute quadriceps active range of motion exercise. The participant was asked to take a rest of 10 minutes before participating in the exercise program. Then, the exercise was performed from a short-sitting position.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline blood pressure at 1 day
primary_outcome.description: Both systolic and diastolic blood pressures were measured by a trained physiotherapist in the right upper arm using an appropriate-sized cuff at the baseline and the end of the intervention using an automated Dinamap MPS Select device (Johnson & Johnson, New Brunswick, NJ).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline respiratory rate at 1 day
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate was assessed by visually observe for 30 seconds and multiply observed breaths by 2 to obtain breaths per minute (BPM).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline oxygen saturation at 1 day
secondary_outcome.description: Oxygen saturation was recorded using a finger pulse oximeter. The sensor was placed on the right index finger, and the values were recorded after at least two minutes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline heart rate at 1 day
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate was recorded using a finger pulse oximeter. The sensor was placed on the right index finger, and the values were recorded after at least two minutes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline mean arterial pressure at 1 day
secondary_outcome.description: Mean arterial pressure was calculated MAP as diastolic blood pressure (DBP) + 1/3 [systolic blood pressure (SBP) - DBP].

arm_group.description: Quadriceps active range of motion exercise.

intervention.description: The participants in the experimental group underwent a single session of 5-minute quadriceps isometric exercise. The participant was asked to take rest 10 minutes before performed the exercise. After that, the exercise was performed from a long-sitting position.

The participants in the control group received a single session of 5-minute quadriceps active range of motion exercise. The participant was asked to take a rest of 10 minutes before participating in the exercise program. Then, the exercise was performed from a short-sitting position.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy individuals and have no chronic diseases
Exclusion Criteria:
- if they have any orthopedic disorders, such as fractures in the lower limbs, dislocation, or acute musculoskeletal injuries.
